subject: Management
title: Intervening Without Taking Over
description: A micro-lesson that makes Intervening Without Taking Over usable.

hook.text: A project was off track, so the manager took it back. The team member felt humiliated.

buildup.text: Taking work back sends a devastating message: I don't trust you.

discovery.text: Instead of reclaiming, coach through. Ask questions that guide without dictating.

twist.text: Intervention means adding support, not removing ownership. There's a huge difference.

climax.text: Say 'How can I help unblock this?' not 'I'll just do it myself.'

punchline.text: Help them finish. Don't finish for them.

quiz.question: What's the best approach when a delegated task goes off track?
options: Coach through it and add support without reclaiming
Take the task back immediately to save time
Let them fail completely as a learning experience
